answers.answer: I developed osteoporosis, rheumatoid arthritis, diabetes, and osteoarthritis after my thyroid surgery (all of which are not uncommon).I've had DEXA scans and nuclear bone density scans (along with all the blood work) and I wasn't taken off any of my meds (except Metformin) for any of the scans.   Not quite sure why but, if you trust your endo, follow his/her advice.  If not, you can always get a second opinion.With your recent thyroid surgery I would venture to guess that your TSH is still off and you may be having calcium problems.

question: Had a partial 30 years ago with no meds.  I had a TT on 7/29, no cancer!  Started on the generic 50 mg and endo put me on 75 brand Synthroid.  I was hypo 30 years without notice of 3 doctors and 5 surgeries.  My joints ache, even my bunions, I am so tired I was supposed to go back to work Monday and just do not have the energy.My tailbone hurts to sit, so driving is painful.  Am I being a baby with the joint pain?I take a 3 mg Lunesta to get to sleep but it only gives me 5 hours.  The question:  My endo told me to stop all vitamins, all calcium, everything (except Lunesta)  until my blood work and bone density scan on 9/29.  Has anyone else been taken off everything to get a flatline, so to speak?  I know I have bone density problems and some arthritis.If I keep feeling worse every day, how will I make it 4 more weeks?.  Today I used Aspercrem on my hands because they hurt so bad and I wanted to use the computer.  I am also taking 3-4 hot baths a day which seem to help about 30 minutes.  On a brighter note, my depression is slightly less.  Is the pain distracting me?  HELP
title: Energy & join pain vs Depression
